column4: could someone please explain what this could mean? "System information disabled due to load higher than 1" when the cpu% and mem% don't add up to anything more than like 5-10% when i do ps aux?
why are my servers so screwed up
waaah
my processes are at status D
and they just stopped writing to the log file
and hte whole computer is basically frozen
but what would cause a disk wait.. my processes arent that many, theyre just celery workers.. i maybe write 50 MB to disk every 3 hours or so
and old log files get deleted.. i dont understand
if many workers are all writing to the same file, the OS should take care of switching who writes when, right? there shouldnt be a deadlock in writing?
if there are many programs writing to the same file, you have issues
the OS doesn't take care of file locking, beyond providing the lock() mechanisms for doing so
it's up to the application to make sure the file doesn't get trashed
a supervisord process starts multiple celery workers, and it has a supervisor log. as far as i can see the outputs of the workers go to the log correctly
freezes?
as in hard lock, the magic-sysrq keys don't work?

the computer is just super slow, it says system load is higher than 1, it's not writing to the log file anymore, i do a ps and i see dozens of CRON jobs (in all uppercase), pstree just hangs, a lot of operations hang
sounds like an application bug
what software is causing the grief?
i have celeryd running tasks on this machine
it seems there is a sudden spike in disk writes shortly before the machine becomes unresponsive
anything in the logs?
try the everything log, hich i believe is either /var/log/messages or /var/log/everything
yes, iotop can log
see man iotop for details of that
